definitions.definition: A close-range shot in which the shooter banks the ball off the backboard from a few feet away.

examples: Meeting the numbers will be a layup , if not a slam dunk.

definitions.definition: The state of being laid up .
examples: The ship endured an interminable layup in the harbor lasting nearly a month.

definitions.definition: A track used to store train cars.
examples: The caboose, long decrepit, rested on a forgotten layup just north of the dry riverbed.

definitions.definition: A train car sitting in storage ( laid up ), often overnight.
examples: Though I knew we shouldn't be there, she pulled me out of the tunnel and into the dark layup , its floors still grubby from the morning commute many hours ago.

definitions.definition: The process of applying alternate layers of a material and a binding agent to form a composite material.
examples: Forgetting to clear the sawdust around his workshop, Payton ended up contaminating the resin-ply matrix with wood particles during his hand layup .

main_definition: ( basketball ) A close-range shot in which the shooter banks the ball off the backboard from a few feet away.
secondary_definitions: The state of being laid up .
( rail transport , countable or uncountable ) A track used to store train cars.
( rail transport ) A train car sitting in storage ( laid up ), often overnight.
( materials science ) The process of applying alternate layers of a material and a binding agent to form a composite material.
